answers.answer: HiWelcome to the forum!Well, the pain can be due to diabetic neuropathy. It can also be due to ViB12 and Vit D deficiency. Another possibility is compression of spinal nerves at the cervical level causing generalized body pains. Fibromyalgia and chronic fatigue syndrome is another possibility.The pains can also be due to peripheral vascular disease which is common in diabetes. This possibility should also be seriously considered as the pain is mainly in legs, feet, hands and arms. Doppler studies or angiograms can be diagnostic. Also get gylcosylated hemoglobin done to know whether the blood sugar control over past 3 months has been good or not. At times poor sugar control can be the cause.Please discuss this with your diabetes specialist.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: I am a type 1 diabetic.  I had it for about 13 years now.  About a year ago i started to get these bad pain in my legs, feet,hands and arms.  The pain was real bad at night, to the point that i was crying.  I went to the doctors and emergency rooms, they did blood work and and other tests everything thing came back normal.  One of the emergency rooms diagnosed that i had diabetic neuropathy, they put me on medications for it and pain pills and it turned out another doctor told me i didn't have diabetic nueropathy.  The doctors were giving me all types of medication but nothing worked.  I was so tired of going to the doctors and them telling me they didn't know what was wrong with me that i just dealt with pain.  The pain finally eased off a little during the summer, but now the pain is back and it feels like it did when it first started.  Im clueless i idon't know why i am getting these pains is there anyone that is experiecing the same symptoms?
title: undiagnosed pains
